title.narrative: SUB-NATL CAPACITY BUILDG PUBLIC POLICY

description.narrative: By September 2015, representatives of public sector and civil society from the prioritized departments and municipalities have increased their capacities to manage public policies that guarantee childrenÂ´s and adolescentsÂ´ rights., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By September 2015, children and adolescents constitute an evidence-based priority in national legislation and in socioeconomic policies, at national and sub-national levels.

participating-org.narrative: WORLD VISION INTERNATIONAL VISION MUNDIAL INTERNACIONAL

PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services

Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By September 2015, representatives of public sector and civil society from the prioritized departments and municipalities haveincreased their capacities to manage public policies that guarantee children's and adolescents' rights.

Number of prioritized territorial authorities that include the Annex of social public spending in their annual budgets, and within it, the items identified as ensuring the rights of children and adolescents appear in equal or higher percentages than the previous year. (It was modified to include the maintenance indicator or increase of GPS assigned to childhood)

Number of departmental observatories on children and adolescents who have: (i) an administrative act of formalization defining their object, structure, functions, operating mechanisms and resources. (ii) An updated database from national and territorial sources on the situation of children and adolescents disaggregated to prove the diversity and (iii) documents analyzing the situation of the rights of children and adolescents with a differentiated approach.

Number of prioritized territories that incorporate information on childhood and adolescence - produced with a differential approach - in their short, medium and long term planning processes (development plans, sectoral plans, Territorial Management Plan, medium-term fiscal framework) or in their monitoring and control processes.

baseline.value: 2 evaluations on the inclusion of children and adolescents in 2004 and 2008 development plans.

title.narrative: Number of dialogue and action scenarios between government representatives and children and adolescents created by the prioritized territorial governments within the framework of formulation, execution and monitoring of public policies for children and adolescents and rated in the participation scale of Roger Hart.
Number of prioritized territories that have a public policy for children and adolescents that has been harmonized with the medium-term fiscal framework.

baseline.value: 3 departments with public policies: Antioquia, Boyaca and Nari?o. (01.2011)

title.narrative: Number of prioritized territorial authorities that are public accountable for their management to improve the quality of life of children and adolescents and for the annual investment to ensure their rights, in accordance with their planned social and financial goals.

baseline.value: 32 departments presented their execution reports which included indicators on social public spending (01.2011)

title.narrative: Number of prioritized territories that reached consensus and have social mobilization processes to connect public, private, community, academic or cooperation sectors to the formulation, implementation and monitoring process of public policies for children and adolescents

baseline.value: Partnerships in its constitution process in the departments of Nari?o, Huila, La Guajira, Antioquia, Boyaca (01.2011)

title.narrative: The National Family Welfare System participates and hosts the training process designed and developed by UNICEF as its territorial technical assistance strategy

baseline.value: The territorial technical assistance strategy has been designed and tested (01. 2011)
